On Fri, 2003-08-01 at 11:09, Pablo S. Casullo wrote:
> Hi guys, 
> 
> does any of you know any tool / framework to test
> applets via its GUI just as if the testing tool was
> the real user?
> 
> regards,
> 
> P!
> 

I've looked at a bunch of these tools recently.

Here's what I found...

1. java.awt.Robot  -- Simple  (Don't recommend it)
2. Abbot -- A Better Bot  more advanced ... 
   http://abbot.sf.net/
3. jfcUnit -- Good!
   http://jfcunit.sf.net/
4. Jemmy -- (Better!)  Similar, but instead of using a helper to find
Components you instantiate a wrapper around the components that you
interact with.
   http://jemmy.netbeans.org/


None of these are identical to the use by

I'm new to TDD and David Astels' book Test-Driven Developement: A
Practical Guide was extremely helpful.  I found out about Jemmy from
it.   
--
